page.title: 05COUNTRY HOUSE Lamport Hall
page.content: Home of Isham family for 400 years. Sir Gyles Isham,12th Baronet,died in 1976 and left the Hall,its contents, and all the land to the Lamport Hall Trust,founded by him to promote "Historic and Aesthetic Education" Children can go and learn things there in the Hall or the grounds,the Church or the Nature Trail.Grown ups can go to art exhibitions and concerts and lectures.They can join the Lamport Society. We went to the Hall with our teacher. We went through the big oak door into the hall and she told us about the pictures.On the wall there was a flag. It had a red hand on it.There is a story about the hand.(see Page 6)
